properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Strathfield Festival will take place from Thursday 27 to Saturday 29 April at Strathfield Square

Road closures will be in place between midnight Saturday 29 April and 2am Sunday 30 April on the following roads:

  • The Boulevarde north of Parnell St traffic lights
  • Albert Rd between The Boulevarde and Strathfield Square
  • Churchill Ave between The Boulevarde and Strathfield Sq
  • Churchill Ave between The Boulevarde and Strathfield Sq will also be closed from 5pm to 10pm on Thursday 27 and Friday 28 April.

Parking restrictions will also be in place around the area. Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Albert Road

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Women's Grand Final. Kick off from 4pm, finish around 6pm.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

roads.mainStreet: O'Connell Street

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Bulldogs at WIN Stadium. Kick-off from 4pm, full time approx 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Local roads around the stadium may close before, during and after the game for the safety of pedestrians.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Harbour Street

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Macarthur FC v Wellington Phoenix at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off from 5pm, full time approx 7pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Panthers v Wests Tigers at Carrington Park in Bathurst. Gates open at 3pm. Preliminary matches from 3:15pm, NRL kick-off from 7:35pm and full time around 9:30pm. 

Allow extra travel time on Havannah St, Great Western Hwy, William St and Sydney Rd.

Motorists exercise caution and should be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Great Western Highway, Bentinck Street, Durham Street

properties.publicTransport: Additional route 199 buses will run after the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sea Eagles v Titans at 4 Pines Park in Brookvale. Kick off from 5:30pm, full-time around 7:30pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pittwater Rd, Old Pittwater Rd, Warringah Rd and Beacon Hill Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium on Friday evening.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra travel time as parking will be in high demand and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pittwater Road

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Raiders v Dolphins at McDonalds Park, East Wagga Wagga. Gates open from 10:45am and preliminary matches from 11am. NRL kick from 3pm until approx. 5pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching McDonalds Park including Kooringal Rd, Hammond Ave, Copland St and Lake Albert Rd.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

roads.mainStreet: Kooringal Road

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in event tickets. Light rail services and buses run frequently to Moore Park so leave the car at home. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby: Waratahs v Highlanders at Allianz Stadium. Gates open 6:30pm, kick-off from 7:35pm and full time around 9:10pm

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd as fans travel to and from the game during the Friday evening peak.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5:30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game. No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP3 grass car park and drop off areas maintained from Lang Rd, from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. EP2 Car park will be closed.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sharks v Cowboys at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Kick-off from 7:50pm and full-time around 9:50pm. 

Road closures will be in place on Captain Cook Drive from approximately 10 minutes before kick off and remain in place until crowds have cleared after full-time.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium may be heavier than usual including Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.otherAdvice:
An AFL match and A-League match will be held in the Moore Park precinct at neighbouring stadiums on Saturday afternoon.

  • AFL: Sydney Swans v GWS Giants at the SCG. Gates open at 12:15pm, first bounce at 2:10pm and final whistle around 4:40pm.
  • A-League Men: Sydney FC v Newcastle Jets at Allianz Stadium. Gates open from 4pm, kick-off at 5pm and full time around 6:30pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 11:15am and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the A-League match.

AFL fans can access EP2 Kippax car park from Moore Park Rd, or from the Eastern Distributor use the Bondi exit. Access EP3 southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd, from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. Car parks open from 1:30pm.

A-League fans will need to use alternative parking outside of the Moore Park precinct as parking will be at capacity prior to kick-off, while the AFL match is already underway. Off-site parking is available at Royal Randwick Racecourse, entry via Ascot Street. From there walk to nearby Royal Randwick or Kensington light rail stops to connect with services to Moore Park. 

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 11am to 8pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Chalmers St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 11AM TO 8PM

  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)

properties.otherAdvice:
The Hawkesbury Show will be held at Hawkesbury Showground in Clarendon from Friday to Sunday. The show starts daily at 9am and finishes at 9pm on Friday and Saturday, then 4pm on Sunday.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including Hawkesbury Valley Way, Blacktown Rd, The Northern Rd and Richmond Rd approaching the Precinct as families travel to the showground over the weekend.

Heavy traffic is expected in Clarendon and surrounding suburbs approaching the showground. Attendees travelling to the show are encouraged to catch trains instead to avoid delays.

roads.mainStreet: Hawkesbury Valley Way, Blacktown Road, The Northern Road, Richmond Road

webLinks.linkText: Mother's Day Classic Fun Run & Walk 2023

properties.publicTransport: Route 441, 500X, 504 and 506 buses will be diverting while road closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of participants will take part in 5km and 10km Mother's Day Classic fun run and walk events starting from 7am in The Domain. Participants will travel along sections of Macquarie St, College St then Art Gallery Rd and Mrs Macquarie's Rd to finish back in The Domain by approximately 11:30am.

Road closures:

  • 5am to 12pm - Art Gallery Rd/Mrs Macquarie's Rd from Prince Albert Rd and Hospital Rd. Access to Hospital Rd is via Shakespeare Pl only in both directions.
  • 6am to 10am - Macquarie St between St James Rd and Hunter St, College St between Park St and Prince Albert Rd and sections of St James Rd, Prince Albert Rd, St Mary's Rd and Yurong Pkwy will be closed.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 5am to 10am on sections of Macquarie St, Hunter St, College St, St Mary's Rd and St James Rd. Clearways will also be in effect on sections of Prince Albert Rd and Hospital Rd from 5am to 12pm midday.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents, businesses or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies so check signs carefully on the day and the night before as clearways come into effect in the early morning. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Mother's Day is traditionally one of the busiest days on the roads. Wherever you are travelling, expect it to take longer than usual and factor in extra travel time.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents, businesses or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies so check signs carefully on the day and the night before as clearways come into effect in the early morning. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 5AM TO 10AM

  • College Street between Park Street and Prince Albert Road (Eastern Side)        
  • Hunter Street between Macquarie Street and Elizabeth Street (Southern Side)
  • Macquarie Street between St James Road and Bent Street (Western Side)         
  • St James Road between Elizabeth Street and Prince Albert Road (Both Sides)        
  • St Mary's Road between Prince Albert Road and Sir John Young Crescent (Northern Side)
  • St Mary's Road between Boomerang Place / Yurong Pkwy and College St (Southern Side) 

FROM 5AM TO 12PM MIDDAY

  • Hospital Road between Prince Albert Road and Sydney Hospital Pedestrian Crossing (Both Sides)      
  • Prince Albert Road between College Street and Hospital Road (Northern Side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

arrangementElements.html:
SYDNEY CBD

FROM 5AM TO 12PM MIDDAY

  • Art Gallery Road from Hospital Road
  • Mrs Macquarie's Road from Art Gallery Road
  • Hospital Road* between Prince Albert Road and Shakespeare Place
  • Prince Albert Road between St Mary's Road and Hospital Road 

FROM 6AM TO 10AM

  • Boomerang Place/ Yurong Parkway between William Street and St Mary's Road (Northbound)
  • College Street between Park Street and Prince Albert Road
  • Macquarie Street between St James Road and Hunter Street
  • Prince Albert Road between St James Road and St Mary's Road
  • St James Road between Elizabeth Street and Prince Albert Road              
  • St Mary's Road^ between Prince Albert Road and Cathedral Street

Notes:

* Access to Hospital Road will be via Shakespeare Place only, in both directions. Vehicle access is limited to vehicles requiring access to Sydney Hospital, emergency services, contracted tow trucks and accredited / authorised event vehicles.

NB: Hospital Road will be heavily used by pedestrians before/during/after the event, crossing in both directions between The Domain and the start/finish line area.

^Managed Local Access into St Mary's Road to Cathedral Street and the Domain car park. St Mary's Rd will be closed at Sir John Young Cres when the Domain car park is full.


CYCLEWAY CLOSURE - FROM 6AM TO 10AM

  • College Street between Park Street and Prince Albert Road (Northbound)

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Eels v Knights at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 6pm, finish around 8pm.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game during the busy evening peak. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd. Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

Roads outside the stadium will close from 7:30pm to 8:15pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Fans should follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police and allow extra time when exiting car parks. If you’re travelling home by taxi or ride share choose a pick up location away from the stadium to avoid traffic delays.

roads.mainStreet: O'Connell Street

properties.otherAdvice:
Cyclists will take part in the Grafton to Inverell Cycle Classic on Saturday 29 April, starting from Prince St in Grafton and finishing on Vivian St in Inverell. The race will commence at 7:00am and the last riders are expected to reach Inverell by 5pm.

The Gwydir Highway between Tindal Road (15km west of Grafton) and Bald Nob Road (25km east of Glen Innes) will be closed westbound from 7:00am to 1:30pm, and closed eastbound from 5:00am to 1:30pm. 

The intersections of the Gwydir Highway at Dodds Lane and Elsmore Road will be under traffic control during the event. 

Motorists are advised to exercise caution, allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic control on site.

Motorists should be aware of the groups of cyclists as they share roads each day. Motorists are also reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.
properties.diversions: Please plan your journey and consider using one of the alternate east-west corridors such as Oxley Highway, Bruxner Highway or Waterfall Way between closure times.

roads.mainStreet: Gwydir Highway

properties.publicTransport:
With Maitland Railway Station being the main hub of the event. Gettting here via train is the easiest way to get to Steamfest. 

Please visit www.transportnsw.info for full timetable information.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 60,000 people are expected to attend the Hunter Valley Steamfest event at Maitland Station over the weekend of 29 and 30 April 2023.

Traffic is expected to be heavy approaching Maitland especially along Cessnock Road, New England Highway, Les Darcy Drive, High Street, Allan Walsh Drive and Ken Tubman Drive.

Motorists are advised to expect delays in the area and follow detours and direction of traffic controllers in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Station Street

properties.otherAdvice:
TWICE at Qudos Bank Arena on Tuesday nd Wednesday night. Show starts from 7:30pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
Midnight Mafia: Order of the Lotus at Sydney Showground from 4pm until midnight.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park, including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. Traffic is also expected to be heavy along Underwood Rd, Hill Rd and Australia Ave before and after the event with increased ride share and taxis in the area.

Other events are also being held at neighbouring venues in the precinct, parking will be in high demand.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park may be closed for the events. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Fans driving should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before to secure a space.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
Meatstock Music and BBQ Festival will be held at Sydney Showground on Friday from 3pm to 10pm, Saturday from 11am to 9pm and Sunday from 10am to 6pm.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct, including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. Traffic is also expected to be heavy along Underwood Rd, Hill Rd and Australia Ave before and after the event each day.

On Saturday night, an indoor concert will also be held in the precinct from 4pm, allow extra travel time as traffic will be in heavy in the precinct.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park may be closed for the events. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Fans driving should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before to secure a space as parking will fill quickly.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Light rail and buses run regularly to Moore Park. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Fatboy Slim at the Showring, Entertainment Quarter on Friday night. Support acts start from 5:50pm, main act from 7:45pm and finish around 9.30pm

Traffic will be heavy in the area as fans travel to the precinct during the already busy Friday evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on Anzac Pde, Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd approaching Moore Park, and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.otherAdvice:
Major road closures will be in place on Sunday morning between 4am and 11:30am in the Sydney CBD, The Rocks, Dawes Point, Millers Point, Barangaroo and Pyrmont for the Runaway Sydney Half Marathon. 10km event starts from 6.30am followed by Half Marathon at 7.25am. Events start from Bridge St at Macquarie St corner of Cahill Exp finishing at St Mary's Cathedral Square on College St.

Motorists are encouraged to avoid non-essential travel in the CBD and Pyrmont areas during the event as delays are expected. Diversions will be in place, follow detour signs and allow extra travel time.

Key road closures:

  • Hyde Park from 2am to 2.30pm: College St between Prince Albert Rd and Park St (event finish line).
  • Circular Quay from 4am to 9.30am: sections of Bridge St and Phillip St.
  • Cahill Expressway and Sydney CBD from 4am to 11:30am: the Cahill Expressway Circular Quay overpass, and sections of Bridge St, Macquarie St and Kent St northbound from Napoleon St.
  • The Sydney Harbour Bridge remains open. Motorists travelling southbound to the Eastern Suburbs can use the Sydney Harbour Tunnel or travel through the CBD to access the Eastern Distributor.
  • The Rocks, Millers Point and Barangaroo from 5am to 11am: Hickson Rd, Argyle St, Pottinger St, Watson Rd, Dalgety Rd and surrounding local roads.
  • Sydney CBD from 5am to 11:30am: Macquarie St between Bent St and St James Rd and Hunter St between Elizabeth St and Macquarie St.
  • The Domain from 5am to 12pm: Art Gallery Rd, Mrs Macquaries Rd, St Marys Rd, Hospital Rd and Yurong Pkwy.
  • Sydney CBD from 6am to 11am: Bent St and Shakespeare Place cross over closed. Motorists can travel east/west of the city via Park St or Goulburn St.
  • Western Distributor from 6am to 9.30am: the Western Distributor from Pyrmont to the CBD including Fig St/Pyrmont St on-ramps and King St off-ramps will be closed. Motorists travelling citybound on the Anzac Bridge will be detoured via the Bathurst Street off-ramp to rejoin the Harbour Bridge. There will be no direct access from the Anzac Bridge to the Sydney Harbour Bridge until 9.30am.
  • Barangaroo and Pyrmont from 6am to 9.30am: sections of Erskine St, Sussex St, Wheat Rd, Darling Dr, Pyrmont St, Pyrmont Bridge Rd, Murray St, Edward St and Union St.
  • Pyrmont from 6am to 10am: sections of Bank St, Bowman St, Harris St, Pirrama Rd north, Refinery Dr, Darling Island Rd and surrounding local roads.
  • Pyrmont from 6am to 10:30am: Pirrama Rd between Darling Island Rd and Union St.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on various roads throughout the Sydney CBD, Circular Quay, The Rocks, Millers Point and Pyrmont between 12.01am and 12pm midday. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.
properties.diversions: Buses will be diverting while road closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

roads.mainStreet: Cahill Expressway, Western Distributor, Macquarie Street, Hickson Road

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Sydney Streets Redfern

properties.publicTransport: Route 308 buses will be diverting around Redfern St while it's closed for the event. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney – Sydney Streets event on Redfern Street. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

  • Redfern St will be closed between Regent St and Chalmers St in both directions from 9am until 11:30pm.
  • Sections of Renwick St, George St and Glover L will also be closed during this time.
  • Pitt St will remain open to allow traffic to cross Redfern St.
  • Motorists travelling west will be detoured via Chalmers St, Cleveland St and Regent St.
  • Motorists travelling east will be detoured via Regent St, Botany Rd and Raglan St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Redfern St, George St and Renwick St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

REDFERN – FROM 9AM TO 11:30PM

  • Redfern St between Regent St and Chalmers St
  • Renwick St* between Turner St and Redfern St
  • Renwick St* between Redfern St and Wells St
  • George St* between Turner St and Redfern St
  • George St* between Wells St and Turner St
  • Glover Ln* between Turner St and Redfern St

*Resident access maintained.

Note: Pitt St will remain open in both directions crossing Redfern St


SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways will be in effect on both sides of the roads below unless stated otherwise. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.


SURRY HILLS – FROM 8AM UNTIL 11:30PM

  • Redfern St between Regent St and Chalmers St
  • George St between Turner St and Wells St
  • Renwick St 22 metres south of Redfern St
  • Renwick St 22 metres north of Redfern St
